page.title: 14Trade in the Butley Area
page.content: There are no shops around Butley so the people go to Ipswich and Woodbridge for consumer durables. A mobile grocer comes round twice a week. He sells things like sweets, cakes, biscuits, bread, drinks and fruit. A milkman comes round five times a week and he also sells fizzy drinks, butter, bread, bacon and sausages. The baker calls twice weekly and he also brings green-groceries. On Friday a fish'n'chip van comes. Wet fish is delivered on a Tuesday. The butcher's van comes around twice a week. A hardware van arrives once a fortnight, he sells paraffin. Yet another van sells shirts, sheets, carpets, cleaning materials and fancy goods. This trader comes two or three times a year. These mobile shops are useful in this rural area.
